intro: Carica jimenezii, commonly known as the Jiménez papaya, is a species of flowering plant in the Caricaceae family. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its large, fleshy, yellow-orange fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth surface and a prominent midrib. The flowers are small, clustered, and usually greenish-white in color, contributing to its ornamental value.
